name: cheddar
description: A hard, often sharp-tasting natural cheese originating from the English village of Cheddar.

name: mozzarella
description: A traditionally southern Italian cheese made from Italian buffalo’s milk by the pasta filata method.

name: brie
description: A soft cow’s-milk cheese named after Brie, the French region from which it originated.

name: gouda
description: A mild, yellow cheese made from cow’s milk, originating from the Netherlands.

name: swiss
description: Known for its distinctive holes or “eyes”, this cheese has a mild, nutty flavor.

name: blue_cheese
description: Characterized by blue or blue-green veins and a strong, sharp flavor.

name: feta
description: A brined curd white cheese made in Greece from sheep’s milk, or from a mixture of sheep and goat’s milk.

name: camembert
description: A moist, soft, creamy, surface-ripened cow’s milk cheese from France.

name: parmesan
description: A hard, granular cheese with a rich, sharp flavor, named after the producing areas near Parma, Italy.

name: roquefort
description: A sheep milk cheese from the south of France, distinguished by its green veins and strong taste.

name: monterey_jack
description: An American white, semi-hard cheese known for its mild flavor and slight sweetness.

name: colby
description: Similar to cheddar but does not undergo the cheddaring process. Named after the town of Colby, Wisconsin.

name: muenster
description: A smooth-textured cheese with an orange rind and a mild flavor, originating from the United States.

name: provolone
description: An Italian cheese that can range in taste from sweet to sharp, made from cow’s milk.

name: ricotta
description: An Italian whey cheese made from sheep, cow, goat, or Italian water buffalo milk whey left over from the production of other cheeses.

name: havarti
description: A semi-soft Danish cow’s milk cheese that is rindless, smooth, and slightly bright-surfaced with a cream to yellow color depending on the type.

name: gorgonzola
description: A veined Italian blue cheese, made from unskimmed cow’s milk. It can be buttery or firm, crumbly and quite salty, with a ‘bite’ from its blue veining.

name: stilton
description: An English cheese, known for its characteristic strong smell and taste.

name: manchego
description: A cheese made in the La Mancha region of spain from the milk of sheep of the Manchega breed.

name: asiago
description: An Italian cow’s milk cheese that can assume different textures, according to its aging.

name: pecorino_romano
description: An Italian cheese made from sheep’s milk, characterized by a sharp, salty flavor.

name: limburger
description: Mexican cheese, traditionally made from raw cow milk or a combination of cow and goat milk.

name: taleggio
description: A semisoft, washed-rind, smear-ripened Italian cheese that is named after Val Taleggio.

name: cotija
description: A hard, crumbly Mexican cheese made from cow’s milk, named after the town of Cotija in Michoacán.

name: Jarlsberg
description: A mild, semi-soft cow’s milk cheese of Norwegian origin.

name: comté
description: A French cheese made from unpasteurized cow’s milk in the Franche-Comté region of eastern France.

name: emmental
description: A yellow, medium-hard Swiss cheese that got its name from the area in west central Switzerland where it originated.

name: queso_blanco
description: A creamy, soft, and mild unaged white cheese, originating in Spain but popular in Latin American cuisines.

name: queso_fresco
description: A Mexican cheese, traditionally made from raw cow milk or a combination of cow and goat milk.

name: fontina
description: An Italian cow’s milk cheese with a creamy and nutty flavor that intensifies with aging.

name: neufchâtel
description: A soft, slightly crumbly, mold-ripened cheese made in the Neufchâtel-en-Bray, French region.

name: mascarpone
description: An Italian cream cheese coagulated by the addition of certain acidic substances such as lemon juice or vinegar.

name: chèvre
description: A type of French cheese made from goat’s milk.

name: gruyère
description: A hard yellow Swiss cheese that originated in the cantons of Fribourg, Vaud, Neuchâtel, Jura, and Berne in Switzerland.

name: queso_de_bola
description: A Dutch Edam cheese exported to the Philippines, it is aged and coated with red wax.

name: paneer
description: A fresh cheese common in the Indian subcontinent, it is an unaged, non-melting cheese made by curdling milk with a fruit- or vegetable-derived acid.

name: halloumi
description: A semi-hard, unripened, brined cheese from Cyprus, it has a high melting point and so can easily be fried or grilled.

name: american_cheese
description: A processed cheese product made from cheddar, colby, or similar cheeses. It is mild with a creamy and salty flavor.

name: cottage_cheese
description: A fresh cheese curd product with a mild flavor. It is made from cow’s milk and is not aged.

name: menonita
description: A Mexican cheese that is smooth, creamy, and semi-soft with a mild, slightly salty flavor.
